name: Aortic Root Replacement in Marfan Syndrome
description: Prophylactic aortic root replacement is the cornerstone of surgical management in Marfan syndrome. This procedure addresses progressive aortic root dilation to prevent life-threatening aortic dissection or rupture. Key decisions include timing based on aortic diameter thresholds and choice between composite graft (Bentall) versus valve-sparing techniques.

code.name: Ascending aorta graft, with cardiopulmonary bypass, with valve replacement

primary_threshold.measurement_method: Echocardiography or CT/MRI - leading edge to leading edge

lower_thresholds.severe_regurgitation: 4.5 cm with significant aortic regurgitation requiring intervention

presentation: Asymptomatic aortic root dilation on surveillance imaging
diagnosis: CT or MRI for complete aortic imaging
treatment: Surgical: Bentall or valve-sparing root replacement

bentall_procedure.description: Composite mechanical valve-conduit graft with coronary reimplantation
bentall_procedure.components: Mechanical valve sewn into Dacron tube graft
advantages: Single intervention for valve and root

disadvantages: May require reoperation if valve fails

bioprosthetic_bentall.considerations: May be appropriate for older patients or anticoagulation contraindicated
bioprosthetic_bentall.concern: Limited durability, especially in young Marfan patients

coronary_reimplantation.button_technique: Coronary ostia excised with aortic wall button

technical_considerations.annular_reinforcement: Consider felt pledgets or strips in friable tissue

distal_anastomosis.location: Usually at sinotubular junction or proximal ascending aorta
distal_anastomosis.technique: Teflon felt reinforcement may be used

cardiopulmonary_bypass.cannulation: Femoral or right axillary if arch involved

outcomes.freedom_from_distal_events: Ongoing surveillance required - 15-30% develop distal aortic pathology

postoperative_management.beta_blockade: Continue indefinitely to protect remaining aorta

surveillance.imaging: Annual CT or MRI of entire aorta
surveillance.focus: Descending thoracic and abdominal aorta for late dilation

postoperative_management.endocarditis_prophylaxis: Per AHA guidelines for prosthetic valves

clinical_pearls: Operate at 5.0 cm or 4.5 cm with risk factors - DON'T wait until dissection
Family history of dissection lowers threshold to 4.5 cm
Valve-sparing root replacement preferred in young patients when feasible
30% of Marfan patients eventually need distal aortic surgery - lifelong surveillance essential
learning_objectives: Apply aortic diameter thresholds for prophylactic root replacement in Marfan syndrome
Compare Bentall procedure versus valve-sparing root replacement
Outline postoperative surveillance requirements after root replacement
